title: Job Openings at CIG Motors Company Limited
content:
CIG Motors Company Limited is one of the African subsidiaries of Choice International Group. We are the exclusive premiere representative of leading Chinese automotive giants, including GAC Motors, JMC Motors, Dongfeng Motors, FAW Group, and Wuling Motors, within the Nigeria and Africa market.

CIG have consistently expanded our market presence nationwide through strategic partnerships and alliances, delivering a portfolio of high-quality and premium vehicles into the African market. We prioritize customer satisfaction and strive to exceed expectations. Our dedication to quality, innovation, and growth remains unwavering as we continue to shape the automotive industry landscape in Nigeria and beyond.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

            
    



1.) Head of Operations

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full time

Job Summary 


	The Head of Operations will oversee the day-to-day operational activities of LAGRIDE, ensuring that services are delivered efficiently, safely, and in line with business goals. This role requires strong leadership, strategic planning, and cross-functional collaboration to drive operational excellence and scale the business sustainably.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead and manage daily operations across the driver network, customer service, fleet management, and logistics.
	Develop and implement operational strategies to support business growth, efficiency, and service quality. 
	Drive execution of company policies and service standards, ensuring compliance with regulatory and internal requirements.
	Collaborate with the Product, Technology, and Customer Experience teams to improve service delivery and operational performance.
	Ensure cost-effectiveness in resource utilization while maintaining high standards in vehicle management, driver support, and customer service.
	Lead the development of operational SOPs, audit processes, and risk mitigation strategies.
	Establish and monitor KPIs and SLAs for all operational units to ensure optimal productivity and customer satisfaction.
	Manage crisis response, emergency operations, and incident reporting protocols.
	Prepare and present regular reports on operational performance, challenges, and improvement plans to executive leadership.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Transport Management, Engineering, or related field (Master’s degree is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 8 years of experience in operations management, preferably within the mobility, logistics, or tech-enabled services sectors.
	Strong leadership and people management skills with experience overseeing large teams.
	Proven ability to analyze complex data, streamline processes, and implement strategic improvements.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.
	Working knowledge of regulatory and safety requirements in the mobility or transport industry.
	Strong proficiency in operations tools, data dashboards, and fleet management systems.


Key Competencies:


	 Strategic thinking and execution.
	Operational efficiency and continuous improvement.
	Leadership and team development.
	Crisis and risk management.
	Customer-centric decision-making.
	Analytical and data-driven.


Benefits


	Competitive salary.
	Health and wellness benefits (HMO).
	Growth and learning opportunities.
	A collaborative and inclusive team environment.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Logistics Executive

Job Location:  Victoria Island, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Logistics Executive to support and streamline our logistics operations.
	This role is critical in ensuring smooth import processes, timely deliveries, and accurate financial documentation.
	The ideal candidate will manage shipping logistics, customs documentation, PAAR applications, inventory tracking, and operational reporting.


Key Responsibilities
Documentation & Compliance:


	Prepare and finalize Agent Final Bills WRS within 2 days of vehicle delivery.
	Ensure accurate documentation for all logistics activities, including invoices, delivery notes, shipping records, and waybills.
	Apply and monitor PAAR (Pre-Arrival Assessment Reports) as soon as SONCAP is received.
	Ensure PAAR validation is completed same day of application and is received within 24 hours.
	Track PAAR progress and escalate any delay in approval or processing.


Shipping & Delivery Operations:


	Coordinate inbound and outbound logistics, including vehicle dispatch, spare parts distribution, and returns.
	Monitor shipping and terminal charges validity to prevent delays in payment and clearance.
	Liaise with customs agents, clearing personnel, freight forwarders, and terminal operators for seamless clearance and delivery of imported vehicles/parts.
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian Customs, SON, and other regulatory agencies.


Logistics Monitoring & Reporting:


	Update the Daily Logistics Sheet, maintaining real-time status on all shipments and deliveries.
	Track and report delivery timelines, potential bottlenecks, and coordinate with relevant internal departments.
	Support the use and optimization of logistics management systems.


Operational Support:


	Align delivery timelines with sales/service departments to meet customer expectations.
	Optimize transport modes/routes for cost savings and efficiency.
	Contribute to continuous process improvement and logistics automation initiatives.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain, Business Administration, or a related field.
	2–3 years of logistics or supply chain experience (automobile industry preferred).
	Hands-on experience with PAAR, shipping terminals, and customs clearance.
	Strong understanding of transportation regulations, inventory control, and international shipping processes.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and logistics ERP tools.
	Excellent organizational, communication, and vendor management skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Familiarity with vehicle documentation and registration is a plus.


Benefits


	Competitive Salary.
	13th Month Allowance.
	Leave Allowance.
	Monthly Performance Bonus.
	Retirement Savings.
	Medical Coverage.
	Learning & Development Budget.
	Opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Fleet Manager (Lagride)

Job Location:  Victoria Island, Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Fleet Manager is responsible for leading the planning, coordination, and execution of fleet-related activities, ensuring the availability, safety, and performance of the vehicle fleet comprising both internal combustion engine (ICE) vehicles and electric vehicles (EVs).
	This role involves supervising the driver workforce, optimizing fleet utilization, overseeing maintenance schedules, and supporting the company’s mobility goals through data-driven operational decisions.
	The ideal candidate will use data-driven insights, cross-functional coordination, and leadership skills to manage fleet logistics and support the company’s strategic growth in Lagos and beyond.


Key Responsibilities
Fleet Operations:


	Oversee day-to-day operations of Lagride’s vehicle fleet, including ICE (internal combustion engine) and electric vehicles.
	Ensure effective allocation, deployment, and rotation of vehicles based on real-time demand.
	Develop and execute operational SOPs for fleet movement, servicing, documentation, and recovery.
	Monitor EV battery performance, charging cycles, and schedule charging activities to minimize downtime.
	Lead scaling of fleet operations into new service areas and ensure readiness of vehicles and infrastructure.


Driver & Vehicle Oversight:


	Supervise a large network of drivers and field agents to ensure optimal vehicle handling, safety, and customer service.
	Liaise with HR and Training teams to schedule onboarding, retraining, and license renewals for drivers.
	Enforce compliance with driving standards, Lagride’s service policies, and state regulatory requirements.
	Review incident and accident reports; liaise with insurance, admin, and legal teams for resolution.


Maintenance & Downtime Management:


	Coordinate preventive and corrective vehicle maintenance, leveraging both internal workshops and vendor networks.
	Ensure all vehicles are serviced and roadworthy with valid papers (insurance, road worthiness, registration).
	Deploy replacement vehicles swiftly in case of breakdowns and follow up until the original is returned to the fleet.
	Oversee fueling and EV charging operations, ensuring accountability and cost-efficiency.


Reporting & Performance Management:


	Generate reports on:
	
		Fleet utilization
		Vehicle downtime
		Driver performance metrics
		Fuel and energy consumption
		Maintenance costs
	
	
	Use fleet management software and dashboards to identify trends and optimize operational decisions


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Transport Management, Engineering, Logistics, or related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in fleet operations, ideally within a tech-enabled transport or ride-hailing company.
	Strong knowledge of both ICE vehicles and electric vehicles (EVs), including servicing and maintenance.
	Excellent leadership and team coordination skills.
	Hands-on experience with fleet management systems, GPS tracking, and data analysis tools.
	Strong problem-solving skills and ability to manage operations in a fast-paced environment.
	Good written and verbal communication skills.

title: Job Vacancies at Digitvant Microfinance Bank
content:
We offer a comprehensive digital banking experience, featuring savings, loans, fund transfers, and online payments via our website and App. Our platform allows customers to manage their finances efficiently and access a wide range of personalised services to meet evolving needs.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Credit Analyst

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Credit Analyst will be responsible for evaluating credit data, assessing the creditworthiness of potential and existing clients, and making recommendations to support sound lending decisions.
	The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and experience in credit risk assessment.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct thorough analysis of financial statements, credit reports, and other relevant data to assess risk.
	Review loan applications to determine eligibility and repayment potential.
	Recommend loan terms based on risk assessment.
	Monitor existing credit accounts to identify early warning signs of potential default.
	Prepare detailed credit reports and present findings to Management.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, regulatory requirements, and industry best practices.
	Collaborate with the recovery team to manage delinquent accounts.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Banking and Finance, Economics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in credit analysis, preferably in a fintech, banking, or microfinance setting.
	Strong knowledge of credit risk principles, lending regulations, and financial analysis.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and financial modeling tools.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy.
	Good communication and report-writing skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: b.owoyemi@digitvant.com and hr@digitvant.com using "Credit Analyst" as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Driver

Job Location: Iba / Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Driver will be responsible for conveying staff, operating company vehicle safely and maintaining it in good condition.


Key Responsibilities


	Safely drive company staff to designated locations.
	Adhere to all traffic laws and company driving policies.
	Keep vehicles clean, fueled, and properly maintained at all times.
	Perform routine checks on the vehicle and report any mechanical issues promptly.
	Maintain accurate trip and mileage records.
	Assist with loading and unloading of goods as required.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE (Senior Secondary School Certificate).
	At least 4 years of proven driving experience, preferably in a corporate setting.
	Valid driver’s license, Valid LASDRI and a clean driving record.
	Good knowledge of road safety regulations and city routes.
	Punctual, disciplined, and respectful.
	Ability to work flexible hours when required.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: b.owoyemi@digitvant.com and hr@digitvant.com using “Driver Application" as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Enterprise Risk Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Are you passionate about building strong risk frameworks that support innovation in financial services? Join our team as an Enterprise Risk Officer and help us protect and grow a dynamic organization at the forefront of digital finance in Africa.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement enterprise-wide risk management frameworks and policies.
	Identify, assess, and monitor operational, financial, compliance, and strategic risks.
	Conduct risk assessments and maintain a comprehensive risk register.
	Coordinate business continuity and disaster recovery planning.
	Report on risk exposures and mitigation strategies to senior management and regulators.
	Foster a culture of risk awareness across the organization.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree / MBA with 3+ years of experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: b.owoyemi@digitvant.com and hr@digitvant.com using the subject "Enterprise Risk Officer" as the subject of the email.

Internal Control Officer Job at Food Concepts Plc




        
    

        
        Food Concepts commenced operations in 2001. From inception, our aim has been clear-cut and focused: to revolutionize the food sector in West Africa and to deliver extraordinary satisfaction to our stakeholders.

Since launching in 2004, Chicken Republic (Subsidiary of Food concepts) has already opened 55 stores in Nigeria and Ghana. On this basis, we are proud of the brand’s hard-earned reputation as the fastest growing chicken QSR in West Africa and the number 1 chicken QSR in Nigeria (both in revenues and number of outlets). In addition, Chicken Republic was ranked as one of Nigeria’s top 20 brands across all categories (Financial Standards Awards 2009).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Internal Control Officer

Requisition ID: 1480
Job Location: Mushin, Lagos
Grade Level: 3
Job type: Full-time
Department: Risk & Compliance Department
Reporting to: Internal Control Manager

Job Purpose


	Ensure compliance to organization process, procedures and policies and other support for Chicken Republic Stores.


Core Responsibilities and Key Result Areas


	Ensures that internal control documentation are accurate and up-to date
	Ensure compliance to organization process, procedures and policies
	Verify and maintain internal control checks and records including assets tags to ensure safeguard of company
	Track cash advance for unnecessary delay in retirement
	Create and maintain error log closed register to ensure that all identified documentation errors are corrected and closed
	Supervise the receipts of goods from suppliers and certify the GRN
	Review of administrative operations (Admin and Maintenance)
	Ensure that all necessary corrections are effected, vouchers properly authenticated
	Review Imprest and relate with stores for any irregularities when necessary
	Conduct a periodic physical verification of stocks asset monthly
	Vouch and verify all payments vouchers for approvals completeness and accuracy
	Prepaid expense retirement review
	Call over of SCD- Finance and finance posting on SAP
	Due diligence and pricing review
	Ensure that all internal control registers are updated and closed daily
	Any other adhoc assignment as assigned by the HOD


Key Performance Indicators


	Time lag between internal control deficiency occurring and reporting
	Numbers of internal control improvement initiatives
	Number of internal control breaches
	Identify and respond proactively to business priorities and key controls
	Timely rendition of report weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly basis to track support provided to the business and impact of such support
	Prompt implementation and corrective action with employees and managers


Job Specifications
Educational Requirements:


	A good first degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field


Professional Requirements:


	Membership of the ICAN, CITN, ACCA, CIS or any other related professional qualification is an added advantage


Experience Requirements:


	Minimum of 2 years of experience in similar role is required.


Knowledge Requirements:


	Financial accounting skills
	Strong knowledge of audit procedures.

  "description": "Ascentech Services Limited is a full-fledged Human Resource Solution Provider incorporated in 2013 with its Head Office in Lagos, Nigeria. Analyst - Customer Acquisition and Compliance Job at MTN Nigeria




        
    

        
        MTN Nigeria - The leader in telecommunications in Nigeria, and a part of a diverse community in Africa and the Middle East, our brand is instantly recognisable. It is through our compelling brand that we are able to attract the right talents who we carefully nurture by continuously improving our employment offerings even beyond reward and recognition.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Analyst - Customer Acquisition and Compliance

Job Identification: 5794
Job Location: Ikoyi / Lagos Mainland, Lagos
Job Category: MTN Level 2
Reports To: Manager - Customer Acquisition and Compliance East
Division: Sales and Distribution
     

            
    



Mission


	To collate and analyze SIM Cards registration, SIMS availability/Supply and Distribution, Activations, Customer Retention and churn  intelligence information on an on-going basis, (in relation to benchmarking and competition) and provide insight to  Customer Acquisition Channel performance.


Description


	Evaluate performance measured against SIM registration channel objectives  in the following areas:
	
		Trade Partner and Customer Acquisition AND compliance Partners
		Walk-in-Centers
		Mobile Lite 
		Connect Stores and Connect Points
		Other Sim Registration Agents (Pentagon).
	
	
	Collect, analyze and interpret a wide variety of Channel data and develop weekly /monthly reports in preparation for business review meetings.
	End- to-end device life-cycle management, tracking, monitoring of device’ heartbeat, utilization and efficiency.
	Engage the regions to follow up on implementation of Customer Acquisition Channel Initiatives.
	Provide and maintain a strong and reliable database to facilitate tracking and improvement of channel services and providing information enabling channel business decisions to be made.
	Prepare monthly, quarterly and year to date (YTD) measurement reports.
	Provide functional support to Customer Acquisition Manager
	Support seamlessly, the end-to-end SIM Acquisition agent’s system up, training, onboardings and exit.
	Analyze relevant best practices and provide recommendations to Customer Acquisition Manager.
	Attend regulatory meetings at state level and share outcome with regional leadership.


Requirements
Education:


	First Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Business Administration, Accounting or any related discipline
	Fluent in English.


Experience
3 - 7 years work experience which includes:


	Minimum of 3 years of experience in an area of specialization; with experience working with others
	Experience working in a medium organization:
	Project planning and reporting, sales/marketing or related function
	Experience using Data Mining Tools
	Telecoms experience would be an added advantage.
